intro: Uragoga penangensis, commonly known as the Penang urara, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features include woody stems and palmate leaves with a distinctive venation pattern. Uragoga penangensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
